Review Text: JW Marriott Medan is truly one of the best luxury hotels in the city. From the moment you walk in, the atmosphere feels elegant, clean, and very well-maintained. The staff are extremely professional, warm, and welcoming ‚Äî they treat every guest with great respect and always offer help with a smile. The rooms are spacious, modern, and very comfortable, with big windows that give beautiful views of the city. The beds are soft, the linens are high-quality, and everything is spotless. The bathroom is also large and well-designed, making the stay feel even more relaxing. The hotel facilities are outstanding. The swimming pool and gym are clean and well-equipped, perfect for unwinding after a long day. The breakfast buffet is amazing, with a huge variety of fresh and delicious food from local and international cuisines. Everything is prepared with care and tastes wonderful. Overall, JW Marriott Medan offers luxury, comfort, and excellent service. It is a perfect choice for both business and leisure travelers who want a peaceful, high-quality stay in Medan. Highly recommended.

Thanks to members of the management team, especially Bhari, Augustinus, and Johannes who provided outstanding service‚Äîwhether it was quick turnarounds or special amenities, they delivered with professionalism and warmth. The dining experience was superb, thanks to the head chef, Angelica, Juli, Nia, Farid, Evelyn, Jess Lynn, Octavia, Pashir, and Andi in the Restaurant, who expertly handled my special dietary requests with care and efficiency. The food was delicious, and their personalized service made every meal enjoyable. Additionally, the door staff and front desk team were consistently kind, professional, and attentive, making check-in/out effortless and always greeting me with genuine hospitality. This hotel truly understands the needs of business travelers, offering luxury, efficiency, and a welcoming atmosphere. I highly recommend it and look forward to staying here again on my next trip! Outstanding service, impeccable stay‚Äîworth every star!

Visited Medan for the first time for my sister‚Äôs wedding and stayed at JW Marriott Medan. To summarise I am beyond impressed with the level of service I received. It‚Äôs not often these days that you find genuine hospitality and care, but JW Marriott reminded me that this art is not lost. Upon arrival, we were assigned a room that unfortunately felt exceedingly humid, the carpet, bedsheets, and sofa were damp, which was concerning since I was travelling with two young children. I raised the issue with Dini, the Room Manager, and to my surprise, the team immediately upgraded us to a much larger, spotless room at no additional cost. They even sent us complimentary cakes along with a sincere apology. At breakfast the next morning, Julian, the Director of Rooms, personally waited for us to finish before checking in to ensure we were comfortable and happy with the new room. Throughout our five-day stay, he continuously followed up with me not in a scripted way, but with genuine care. Even our cleaner (my apologies for forgetting the name) left a handwritten thank-you note, which was such a warm and thoughtful touch. The attention we received felt truly personal, I never felt like just another guest. While no hotel is perfect, what truly matters is how they respond when things aren‚Äôt right. In that regard, JW Marriott Medan went above and beyond. If I ever return to Medan, there‚Äôs no doubt I‚Äôll be staying here again. Highly recommended for anyone who values sincere hospitality and exceptional service.

At first, I contacted the reservation team for two full days and received no response, so I left a negative review and initially decided not to stay here. However, in the end, I decided to book two rooms for one night and was finally assisted by the reservation team (This case has been resolved and the apology was accepted after they responded to my review) All payments were handled smoothly, even though I‚Äôm currently in the U.S., I was able to make the booking easily for my sibling‚Äôs graduation in Indonesia. All of our requests were fulfilled, and even with several reschedule requests, we were not charged any extra fees. Thanks for that The check-in process for my family went smoothly. Although one room was not ready at the time, everything else went well, and my family was very happy. We had a special request for a graduation message written on the mirror, and it was beautifully done. Thank you so much to the team (especially Grace) who decorated the room, and to the pastry team for the lovely cake. Breakfast had a wide variety of options, though some items like bread and Jam were placed separately in a different area, which could be improved for better convenience. Just a small suggestion. But it was explained clearly in the end, and the staff apologized for the misunderstanding. When exiting the parking lot, my family were charged Rp 25,000, which was fine, but maybe it would be helpful if parking registration procedures were explained during check-in, since not everyone is aware of this policy. Overall, great service. Best of luck to the JW Marriott team. my entire family was happy with the stay

This hotel was very pleasant, especially for the price and given the location. I stayed for 3 nights in total in two different rooms (over two occasions, either end of a 10 day tour of Northern Sumatra). On the first occasion they upgraded me to the executive room (I think that's what it was called). I didn't realise and was quite surprised when I opened the door. It was enormous, with huge windows on two sides. It was very luxurious, though facing what I suspect was North-West the air-conditioning struggled to keep up with the heat from the sun on the windows. Despite being on 16 degrees the room never got below 26, even in the morning. It was warm, but bearable and still comfortable. Air-con in Indonesia seems a little different from other tropical countries I've been to. It takes the edge off, but certainly doesn't make the room cool. The second room I stayed in, which was much more standard (but still fairly spacious and very comfortable) coped much better, and the temperature was lower. The location was great, right across the road from a big shopping centre. The food court inside was excellent, with lots of good quality local food. There is also a supermarket just around the corner for basic needs. It's walking distance to places like the Chinese mansion, and the Sunday markets. The facilities are good, but just barely scraping by. The sauna was great, but the mechanism was variable, with the temperature being over 100 degrees on the first day (I've honestly never been in a sauna that is so hot, and I've been in a lot of saunas; the thermostat seemed stuck on). The other days it was a much more normal 60-70 degrees. Either way I got a good sweat up. The spa was lukewarm (board said it was 40 degrees; it was not. More like 35). The steam room was being repaired. The plunge pool was fantastic. Freezing, and probably the coldest thing in all of Sumatra üòä! It was wonderful after having a good sweat. Some of the other patrons didn't understand the basic courtesy of showering after the sauna and before the spa/plunge/pool, so you're kind of swimming in people's sweat. Some multilingual instructions might be helpful? The tiles were unfortunately treacherous; maybe some grip strips need to be installed? I almost stacked it several times as I aquaplaned across the floor. The gym was great. Excellent new equipment and a really nice space. The staff were very friendly, giving a towel and bottle of water each time you worked out. They even remembered my name even though I was only there a couple of day. The breakfast was nice enough, with some gluten free options (I have coeliac). Bizarrely, although they had some little GF cakes, there was no GF bread. Probably consider getting the bread before other types of pastry. Overall the hotel was pretty nice, but a little old, tired and in need of some more aggressive renovations in the sauna area, but still functional and clean. Like everywhere in Sumatra you need to drop 1 or 1.5 stars to get a sense of what the place is actually like (i.e. it's really more of a 4 star hotel, despite technically ticking the boxes for that rating). It's still probably the nicest hotel in the city.

Update to my review below: I must say that the staff try so hard to make the experience the best at the JW. From personalised welcomes, asking if there is anything they can help with (such as special requests at breakfast, and even putting together a take away food box for me). On my final night in Medan (after a trip to Lake Toba) I re-stayed at the JW. It was like returning home and immediately I felt at peace after a long and crazy day on the road. Yuni welcomed me in the lobby and then checked me in at executive lounge, making sure I felt very welcomed. I was provided a lovely room with a nice little note and gift welcoming me back. I only had a very short overnight stay, but the food in the lounge was delicious and helped me wind down after the long day. Big shout out to Yuni for her help and attention to service. Just fantastic and upgrading my review based on this. Previous review: The JW in Medan seems slightly confused. In one moment, it tries to be luxurious and does hit the mark in many areas, yet in the next it feels very disappointing in its delivery. Okay, I booked two rooms including executive lounge access. It was a very busy time in the JW over the NY celebrations. Big queues to lifts (noting that at the busiest time only 2 of the 3 lifts were in operation - not sure why as 3rd lift started operating again once the crowds reduced, a little bizarre! ). The executive lounge is probably the worst executive lounge I have visited based on its very limited offering. It is also not the most welcoming of spaced with a lack of furnishings and simple offerings. However it does make up some ground during the so called cocktail hours (6-8pm) where the food was reasonable and there was some very basic wine and beer (and one supposed cocktail being a J&T). But staff were very pleasant and worked hard to make the experience the best. On the last night Nurul was amazing and very personalble. She made us all feel very welcome! For the rest of the experience the room was fine, but not grand. The pool is a big disappointment with very bare concrete areas and a lack of lounge or bar. You can order room service there but it took for ever to arrive, but it was a very busy time. Food overall was great, especially the breakfasts. The gym is good and was up there with the best. The staff were super friendly and tried so hard to make it he experience very personalised. However, I would say that this is not a JW experience. I have travelled extensively and stayed at many Bonvoy properties along with many others, and while I was satisfied with the stay it could have been so much more if small tweaks were made to improve the property and how it delivers. It is really missing that luxury experience, and that is why we stay at JW.

Menginap selama 3 malam, dari hari kerja hingga akhir pekan hingga 22 Juli. Berikut ulasan lengkap saya hingga hari terakhir. SARAPAN: (-) Saya rasa manajer restoran mereka seharusnya mengelola restoran mereka yang sibuk dengan terus memeriksa kebersihan meja dan memeriksa setiap gelas air kosong, daripada menyajikan sarapan di depan tamu. Dalam pengalaman saya, belum pernah melihat manajer yang hanya makan tanpa memeriksa kesiapan meja yang sebelumnya digunakan pelanggan. Catatan untuk manajer Anda, ayolah, ini Marriott. Saya mengamati sarapan Anda selama 2 hari. Serbet, baik Jade maupun sarapan, tidak pernah diletakkan penuh di atas meja. Peralatan makan, gelas, dan mug tidak lengkap. Terkadang Anda harus memanggil staf untuk mengisi gelas, terkadang mereka menawarkan Anda untuk mengisi gelas. (+) Staf dapur sangat baik, rapi, penuh perhatian, dan cepat. Variasi makanannya cukup baik untuk sarapan internasional, India, dimsum, dan 3 menu lokal. Pilihan buahnya sangat banyak. KAMAR: (-) Saya tidak berdaya, saya tidak tahu harus berkata apa. Warna bohlam lampu di kamar saya tidak sama, suhu kamar mandi berbeda dengan kamar terhubung. Perlengkapan kamar mandi seperti sampo, dll. berbeda. Kaca shower hampir pecah, tapi ya mereka memperbaikinya setelah kami menghubungi resepsionis. Sungguh.. Oh juga, kotak tisu kamar mandi berdebu, pegangan bak mandi longgar, AC rusak yang tidak bisa menyesuaikan suhu, yang perlu diperbaiki selama 2 jam, tapi saya tidak mau memperbaikinya dan mengandalkan suhu dari kamar terhubung. (+) Tempat tidur rapi dan bersih, Wi-Fi-nya bagus, kulkas, TV, dan kamar yang luas dan tenang. Mereka memiliki laci yang cocok untuk tamu yang menginap lama. Mohon latih resepsionis untuk memperhatikan dan berbicara dengan pelanggan yang mengantre di concierge karena menunggu ketika staf concierge tidak ada di tempat, meskipun mereka sedang menangani pelanggan yang mengantre (hanya 2 atau 3). Membuang waktu lebih dari 5 menit hanya untuk meletakkan kotak saya tanpa menyapa. Saya tidak keberatan jika resepsionisnya sibuk, tetapi mereka terus mengobrol ketika saya menelepon resepsionis dari concierge, sampai saya harus berteriak keras 2-3 kali agar staf berhenti berbicara dan bertanya kepada saya. Untuk Restoran Jade: Makanannya sungguh luar biasa, staf prianya sangat perhatian. Tetapi saya pikir mereka membutuhkan seseorang untuk berdiri agar tamu dapat dipanggil lebih cepat. Mungkin mereka kekurangan staf? Terakhir, mereka diberitahu bahwa mereka akan melakukan sesuatu di kamar saya untuk ulang tahun pertama bayi saya. Tetapi mereka lupa sampai saya harus mengingatkan mereka dan mencari alternatif lain untuk memastikan saya memiliki kue untuk bayi saya. Dan ya, mereka datang untuk mendekorasi kamar. Terima kasih kepada Mba Enjelica dan pasangannya, saya sangat menghargai itu. Terima kasih atas struk dan concierge Bapak dengan keramahan yang hangat dan mengingat beberapa detail, dapur yang rapi dan staf dapur yang hangat, sempurna. Kami juga menghargai kehangatan dari staf di hari terakhir. Mungkin saya terlalu berharap seperti hotel Marriott lainnya. Hotel ini agak mahal, tapi kerapiannya agak kurang dibandingkan hotel Marriott lain yang pernah saya kunjungi. Semoga bisa diperbaiki secepatnya. Oh, mereka juga mengakomodasi pelanggan untuk memesan sesuatu dari Gojek atau Grab.
